creator: Jed_Anderson@oti.com
text:
It would be nice if the unzip task could fix the permissions of files it creates
to match the permissions that are stored in the zip file.  Specifically, it
would improve our build cycle if we could use ant to unzip shell scripts without
having to twiddle that bit.

This isn't an issue on win32, so categorizing this as an OS: ALL issue isn't
quite right.  Sorry bout that.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
that would be nice, but it has to into the CANTFIX bin as there is no way to
read or write permissions in java. <chmod> execs "chmod" as a workaround.

recommendations: use <tar> with explicit perms, then untar at the far end using
Gnyu tar.
